data.title: Lisa Simpson. The Simpsons, original animation production drawing. animation cel
data.meta_description: Lisa Simpson. Original production drawing. Framed. Animation-'Layout' (pose) drawing used in the TV series 'The Simpsons'. 1995.  20th Century Fox. Animation Studio: Film Roman. The Simpsons (S6 E8)  'Lisa on Ice' episode of The Simpsons Season 6 Episode 8. Production code. 2F05.The animation drawing is on pegged animation paper. orange-red pencil and graphite. Mounted on a complimentory dark card with a white frame.(12"x8") Print Size:  12- field animation paper.Frame: 14x11inHeight: 31cmWidth: 38.5cmDepth: 3cmWeight: 0.92kgFrame Type:Single
data.text: Lisa Marie Simpson is a fictional character in the animated television sitcom series The Simpsons. She is the middle child of the Simpson family. Voiced by Yeardley Smith, Lisa was born as a character in The Tracey Ullman Show short "Good Night" on April 19, 1987. Klasky Csupo studio was given the opportunity to produce and animate a new series of one-minute cartoons which featured a family called 'The Simpsons', created by Matt Groening. Klasky Csupo produced and animated all 48 shorts (season 1-4), and when it became one of the most popular segments on the show, Fox began airing a weekly half-hour series entitled 'The Simpsons'. Klasky Csupo also conceived the idea of The Simpsons characters having yellow skin, and Marge Simpson having blue hair. Film Roman (founded by Phil Roman) continued the 20th Century Fox show 'The Simpsons', from season 4 to season 28.
